intro: Spigelia loganioides, commonly known as redroot, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant features tubular, red-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its roots are reddish in color and have been historically used in traditional medicine. Spigelia loganioides is often found in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial shade.
